graphicslib3D

Class GLSLUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.GLSLUtils

  • public class GLSLUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines a set of static utility methods useful when manipulating GLSL shader programs in a JOGL OpenGL environment, including routines to read shader source from a file, fetch and print shader and shader program information logs, and check for OpenGL errors.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLSLUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkOpenGLError()
      Prints a message describing any OpenGL errors which have occurred.
      static void printProgramLog(int program)
      Fetches and prints the Program Information Log for the GLSL shader program specified by parameter "program", which must be a legal GLSL program object ID.
      static void printShaderLog(int shader)
      Fetches and prints the Shader Information Log for the GLSL shader specified by parameter "shader", which must be a legal shader object ID.
      static void printShaderSource(java.lang.String[] program)
      Prints the set of lines contained in the specified array, which is assumed to be a GLSL shader program with each line terminated with an appropriate line terminator.
      static java.lang.String[] readShaderSource(java.lang.String filename)
      Reads the specified text file and returns an array of strings where each string contains one line of text from the file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLSLUtils

        public GLSLUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • readShaderSource

        public static java.lang.String[] readShaderSource(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads the specified text file and returns an array of strings where each string contains one line of text from the file. One line of text from the file is defined as all characters up to, but not including, a line terminator (CR, LF, or CRLF). Each returned string is terminated with a LF ("newline") character. An IOException is generated if no file named "filename" is found. Changed to use Scanner in 2016 by Scott Gordon.

      • printShaderSource

        public static void printShaderSource(java.lang.String[] program)
        Prints the set of lines contained in the specified array, which is assumed to be a GLSL shader program with each line terminated with an appropriate line terminator.

      • checkOpenGLError

        public static boolean checkOpenGLError()
        Prints a message describing any OpenGL errors which have occurred. Returns true if errors were found; false otherwise. Input parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable, from which the GL context to be checked for errors is extracted. Changes made in 2016 by Scott Gorodn: name changed from printOpenGLError() to checkOpenGLError(), drawable object removed from parameter list.

      • printShaderLog

        public static void printShaderLog(int shader)
        Fetches and prints the Shader Information Log for the GLSL shader specified by parameter "shader", which must be a legal shader object ID. Parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable giving the current GL context. Changes made in 2016 by Scott Gorodn: name changed from printShaderInfoLog() to printShaderLog(), drawable object removed from parameter list.

      • printProgramLog

        public static void printProgramLog(int program)
        Fetches and prints the Program Information Log for the GLSL shader program specified by parameter "program", which must be a legal GLSL program object ID. Parameter "drawable" must be a valid GLDrawable giving the current GL context. Changes made in 2016 by Scott Gorodn: name changed from printProgramInfoLog() to printProgramLog(), drawable object removed from parameter list.
